txt.en:
'It looks as though you have strayed a little ways from home, [placeholder], and you want to learn the art of work with gems and fine metals?

'It seems, then, that you have come to the right place.

'You want to speak with Nisti by the workbench. He will be able to set you upon the path of jewelcrafting.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Jewelcrafting, is it? A fine choice for any self-respecting dwarf!

'We make some of the finest pieces of jewellery and gems in all the world, of that there is no doubt. Go over to the workbench and speak with Nisti.

'He will set you on the path to becoming another in a long litany of fine jewellers.'

'You are far from home, [placeholder]. We will honour your request and help you as you learn the art of jewelcrafting.

'Haldan, near the workbench, is an apprentice in the art of jewelcrafting. If you are looking for guidance, I am certain that he will be willing to assist you with the fundamentals of the craft.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'There is power to be held in gems, of all the races, we Elves know this well. We revere those who can craft such detailed pieces of jewellery and gems.

'I have asked one of our promising novices to watch over and guide any new jewellers towards learning the very basics of the profession. His name is Haldan, and he stands near the workbench here at the terrace.

'Speak with him, and he will teach you the very basics as he progresses in his own studies.'

'You will find Berylla Goodchild near the workbench here in the Crafting Area. 

'She is knowledgeable in the art of jewelcrafting and is awaiting the arrival of new would-be jewellers. 

'Speak with her if you are interested in learning and practicing the jewelcrafting profession.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>
You have made a copper ring

'I love to wear rings and bangles. Perhaps when you are more experienced, you can make me some finery.\n\n'You will want to speak with Berylla Goodchild over near the workbench. She has volunteered her time and energy to teach all the new apprentices. Mind her well.'
You have made a Copper Ring!

'Well, look at you. I do not often see your folk here, and when I do, I always find it a bit queer. Well, hobbits less so because of the hill.

'Oh, I am sorry, you wish to know more of jewelcrafting? It just so happens that there is a fine jeweller in this very hall, still learning, but taking to the art very quickly. His name is Ted Ragwort, and you will find him by the workbench in the larger room.

'Good day, [placeholder].'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Jewelcrafting is a goal worth pursuing, and there are many fine jewellers in Combe.

'I have secured the time and teaching of Ted Ragwort, a novice jeweller, but a fine student who is quickly refining his art to teach all those who are looking to set out as jewellers.

'He can be found near the workbench, here in the Craft Hall of Combe.'

'Hullo, there. I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of jewelcrafting. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I will try to not move too quickly for you, but if I do, speak with me again to ask more pointed questions.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new jeweller -- ingredients. Everything you need to make a copper ring is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Jeweller vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Jeweller's training and continued work.</rgb>

Jewellers create adornments that can be imbued with some measure of power. They are a welcome member of the Crafting Guilds.

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Be careful! You will need to complete the correct recipes and deliver the correct items outlined in this quest. 

You will need to execute the copper ring recipe and deliver the copper ring. Failing to do so will force you to obtain new raw materials or to restart the quest after a 24-hour delay.</rgb>
Speak with the Novice Jeweller near the workbench in the crafting area
You have been provided with ingredients
Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> given to you by the Novice Jeweller to collect the copper ingots
You now have all the ingredients to make a copper ring
Using the ingredient you received, craft a <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ring</rgb>
Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ring</rgb> to the Novice Jeweller
#-1:[placeholder]Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>Copper Ring</rgb> to #-1:{Beryllia[O]|Haldan[L]|TBD[D]|Ted}
'Do you have the copper ring on you? I do not see it. I hope you did not ruin it or sell it for coin. I would like to inspect that work. You had best find a way to make another.'
You should speak with the Novice Jeweller to learn more about jewelcrafting.

The Novice Jeweller provided you with a <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> full of ingredients that you can use to execute the copper ring recipe. Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> to get the ingredients.\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Jewellers are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>
The Novice Jeweller provided you with the ingredients necessary to create a copper ring. Approach the workbench and prepare the <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ring</rgb>.
The recipe is complete. <rgb=#FF00FF00>Do not sell the copper ring!</rgb> It is time to show your handiwork to your mentor, the Novice Jeweller.

#-1:[placeholder]The recipe is complete. <rgb=#FF00FF00>Do not sell the Copper Ring!</rgb> Time to show your handiwork to you mentor #-1:{Beryllia[O]|Haldan[L]|TBD[D]|Ted}. Show them how well you did in executing your first jeweller recipe.

'If you are looking for guidance in jewelcrafting, then I am prepared to offer you direction.

'If my methods are too fast, feel free to speak with me again, and I will answer any questions that you may have. I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I have kept some of these ingredients aside for purpose of providing to new jewellers. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Jeweller vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Jeweller's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak at once with the jeweller trainer.'

'Well, look here, another would-be jeweller. I am pleased to meet you and looking forward to helping you get started.

'If I go too fast, or you need help at any point, you can ask me questions about jewelcrafting, and I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I set aside a few for new jewellers like yourself. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Jeweller vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Jeweller's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak at once with the jeweller trainer.'

'Hello, there. I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of jewelcrafting. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I will try not to move too quickly for you, but if I do, speak with me again to ask more pointed questions.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new jeweller -- ingredients. Everything you need to make a copper ring is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Jeweller vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Jeweller's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak at once with the jeweller trainer.'

'Let me see what you were able to do....'

She inspects the ring with a discerning eye.

'I see no seam in the metal, and it is smooth against the skin. 

'I think that you have done very, very well, [placeholder]. I approve and declare you a novice jeweller.'
'You should speak at once with the jeweller trainer.'
'Oh no, did you sell your copper ring? Well, I need to inspect one, so you had better find a way to make me another.'

'Making the copper ring should be simple. Take your jeweller's tools to the workbench and work the metal down into a ring.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Jeweller tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: in order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Jewelcrafting requires a workbench.</rgb>

'Let us see what you have gone and made.'

He inhales deeply and brings the ring to eye level.

'The metal appears smooth, and there are no immediate flaws that I can see.

'You pass, [placeholder]. You are on your way towards becoming a master jeweller!'

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>jeweller's tools</rgb> and make sure you have them equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the workbench.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Jewellers are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>
'I hope you did not ruin the ingredients for the ring? Or did you sell it for some meagre coin. Well...I cannot pass you without seeing your handiwork. Back to the workbench with you!'

'You will first need to make the copper ring. Go to the workbench and craft the copper ring.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Jeweller tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: in order to execute a recipe you must be near the proper facility. Jewelcrafting requires a workbench.</rgb>

'Just open up that <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> full of ingredients that I gave you, and you can start making the copper ring over by the workbench. Make sure to equip your <rgb=#FF00FF00>jeweller's tools!</rgb>'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Jewellers are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Do you have the ring so that I may view it?'

He takes a moment to admire your handiwork.

'This appears to be a well-crafted piece of jewellery. You are well on your way towards becoming a jeweller. Well done, [placeholder].'

'To make the copper ring, you will need to open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I provided to you. Equip your <rgb=#FF00FF00>jeweller's tools</rgb> and head to the workbench and begin crafting.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Jeweller are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>jeweller's tools</rgb> and make sure you have them equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the workbench.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Jewellers are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>
'Have you forgotten something? Do you have the ring that you were to deliver to me? You should return with one.'
Introduction to Jewelcrafting

'Making the copper ring will be easy. Shape the metal into a ring over by the workbench. Little else needed to do beyond that.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Jeweller tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: in order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Jewelcrafting requires a workbench.</rgb>

'Making the copper ring is simple. Work the metals over by the workbench and craft the ring. Then you will have everything that you need.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Jeweller tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: in order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Jewelcrafting requires a workbench.</rgb>

'Let me see what you have done.'

He examines the ring closely.

'I see no flaws, and the metal feels smooth and appears well polished.

'I think that this is a very good effort and proves that you are prepared to continue your work towards becoming a master jeweller.'
